ratings.comment: Goods: Great guy, helpful, def wants you to learn, first professor in the engineering department i encountered who sends us well written emails to try keep us updated with stuff relevant to class. Bads: lectures somewhat unorganized, stopped uploading lecture outlines in the middle of semester, score distribution changed greatly @end of semester
Worst prof I've ever had. Useless, disorganized lectures. Offers students excuses about how busy he is rather than practice exams or review sessions. Avoid him, he will just waste your time.

One of the worst profs I've ever had. Very disorganized, will change lab requirements halfway through the lab and won't tell students. Seems incapable of giving a straight answer . Always talked about homework but never assigned any and never hands back work, so you never know how you are doing in the class. Avoid him if you can1
Extremeley structured and extremeley organized, knows his stuff real well. he helps students with assignments and is willing to do about anything to keep his students happy and content!!!

Worst structured class I have experienced in college.  No grade until the final grade came out.  No hw handed back.  I never saw one score other than online hw. He means well, but doesn't seem to have time to help or organize the class.
Incredibly disorganized. He's a nice guy and wants you to learn, but you'll never see a grade until your final grade. He just is way too busy to be bothered with reading all those lab reports.

Our heat transfer class was based 60% on HW, 30% exams, and 10% projects.  Tim presented the material very clearly and succinctly in class, and was extremely available outside of class to answer questions.  We ended up having no exams, and our grade was based 100% on our 7 HW's, which took about 15hrs each.  Most of the class got an AB or B.

Definately the best professor I've ever had. Cares genuinely for student's learning. Fair tests and grading. The homework is worth a ton of the grade, is collected daily, and is graded harshly and I find it hard to perform on.

tim is the best teacher ive had in my college career.  he truly cares about students and constantly checks his email to answer questions. the material can be tough, but if you do the HW & goto class and office hours, you will do fine.  he busts his ass for students and it really pays off. his passion makes every lecture interesting and funny
Great instructor.  Would take any class with him.  Wants students to do well and works very hard to help you understand.  Tests are hard, but you will definately be prepared if you pay attention.
